questions.question_text: Once a major case candidate is approved a major case is created. What then happens to the customer case?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

If the candidate case was proposed from an existing case, a major case is created and the candidate case becomes a child case of that major case.
If the candidate case was created directly, the candidate case becomes the major case.

choices.C: The customer case becomes the parent case of the major case
choices.A: The customer case becomes a child case of the major case
choices.D: The customer case will automatically be related to a problem
choices.B: The customer case will be automatically closed

questions.question_text: What are the types of units used to measure entitlements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Entitlements are counted on a per unit basis. The Unit field on the Service Entitlement form defines the unit type, either cases or hours.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/configure-csm-entitlements.html

Selected Answer: AD
AD is correct. 

Entitlements are counted on a per unit basis. The Unit field on the Service Entitlement form defines the unit type, either cases or hours.

choices.B: Provide answers and responses to common issues or questions

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
ABD I believe is correct

ABD I believe is correct

questions.question_text: How are ServiceNow’s out-of-the-box Customer Service Management applications packaged? (Choose two.)
Which of the following statements is correct regarding product models in CSM?

choices.D: Product models can contain both physical items and digital (logical) items in the same mode
choices.A: Products models can only contain digital (logical) items
choices.B: Product models can contain either physical items or digital (logical) items but not both in the same model
choices.C: Product models can only contain physical items

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer.
In the CSM Fundamentals On Demand Course > Customer Service Management Foundation Data > Product Portfolio > Product Models and Asset Records
It states "Product models can contain both physical items and digital (logical) items in the same model, as well as other sub-components."

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
I think D is correct
